newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Stability pact agreement still eludes EU finmins.
newsitem.headline: Stability pact agreement still eludes EU finmins.

text.p: Agreement on a stability pact for budgets following the introduction of a single currency continued to elude European Union finance ministers into the early hours of Friday morning, EU diplomats said.

"No agreement has been reached," one diplomat said after ministers took a short break. Another said EU countries remained divided over a new proposal that would allow EU ministers a final say in whether to impose fines on countries with excessive deficits.
The talks have been going on for nearly 10 hours ahead of a summit of EU leaders due to start in Dublin on Friday. - Dublin summit newsroom +353 1 475 9483
